title: randomwalk - Asynchronous Pixel Walking Simulation
text: randomwalk implements parallel random walk simulations create fractal graphs asynchronous pixel walking grid. DLA (Diffusion-Limited Aggregation) simulation, simple random walk builds fractal-like patterns.

title: randomwalk - Asynchronous Pixel Walking Simulation
text: True asynchronous parallel processing separate R worker processes Real-time grid state synchronization across workers via DuckDB Comprehensive statistics tracking percentiles formatting Responsive Shiny UI doesn’t block simulation performance Programmatic API use without GUI Automatic resource cleanup process management Debug panel detailed system monitoring Graceful fallback synchronous mode dependencies unavailable

title: randomwalk - Asynchronous Pixel Walking Simulation
code: # Install from GitHub (once published) # remotes::install_github("johngavin/randomwalk")  # Or install locally devtools::install()

title: randomwalk - Asynchronous Pixel Walking Simulation
code: library(randomwalk)  # Run a simulation directly result <- run_simulation(   grid_size = 20,   n_walkers = 8,   neighborhood = "4-hood",   boundary = "terminate",   workers = 3 )  # Access simulation results result$grid           # Final grid state result$statistics     # Statistics result$walker_paths   # Walker trajectories

title: randomwalk - Asynchronous Pixel Walking Simulation
code: library(randomwalk)  # Launch the Shiny app run_random_walk_app()  # Or run in background to free up console bg_process <- run_app_in_bg()

title: randomwalk - Asynchronous Pixel Walking Simulation

title: Run a Random Walk Simulation — run_simulation

title: Run a Random Walk Simulation — run_simulation
text: grid_size Integer. Size grid (n x n). Default 10. n_walkers Integer. Number simultaneous walkers. Default 5. Must 1 60% grid size. neighborhood Character. Either "4-hood" "8-hood". Default "4-hood". boundary Character. Either "terminate" "wrap". Default "terminate". workers Integer. Number parallel workers (0 = synchronous). Default 0. Note: Async implementation yet available version. max_steps Integer. Maximum steps per walker forced termination. Default 10000. verbose Logical. TRUE, enables detailed logging. Default FALSE.
